data.title: Great Hindu Temple
data.text:
We visit this temple almost every week. The new expansion to the temple is underway which means there is more room in the temple but also some construction stuff lying in the parking lot. 

Good place to visit if one whats to learn more about Hinduism and Hindu gods.

data.title: Nice Hindu Temple In the Heart of Salt Lake County!!
data.text: Even though it says South Jordan, the temple is about 5-10 minutes from the main interstate I-15 in Salt Lake City. Recently, about a year back, the temple was renovated and since then the temple now has several more dieties, besides lord Ganesha, Shiva/Parvati and Balaji. In fact they have expanded the temple floor area, added several halls and classrooms. The priests are friendly and conduct hindu rituals very diligently. One festive days, this place is more crowded and parking can be difficult.

data.title: It was located at the best decent place.
data.text: We went to the temple in a busy day. It was located in a decent inside place where u can escape the day break.

data.title: Fest of Colors
data.text: ALways a fun place to visit- the llamas are cool, I have also done yoga there, which was really neat!!

data.title: Pilgrimage spot
data.text: This is my favorite temple in the US mainland. There is a sense of peace, and you can tell it;s very well run. The idea of paying for ceremonies by just putting the money in the hundi gives a welcoming sense of trust amongst devotees, often not seen in other temples. I really appreciated that.

data.title: Nice but should be respected more
data.text:
Temple is quiet and great with nice facilities. But we went to the temple on a Saturday (busy day) and there were many people coming in to the temple. The priest was doing some private event within the premises and he dint even care about other people visiting. There was nobody to do 'aarti' and people were just praying and leaving...

I think normal people should also be respected along with the rich people doing special pooja and paying more for the temple..

data.title: Beautiful Hindu temple
data.text: I visited the temple with my granddaughter.  The priest was very welcoming.  We removed our shoes and placed them in a special room before we entered the sacred temple room. Offerings to their sacred God are welcome but not required.

data.title: Hindu Temple - Salt Lake City, UT
data.text: Since Salt Lake City is known for Temple Square downtown, I looked up other temples online and found the Sri Ganesha Hindu Temple.  The temple itself is nestled behind retail and residential area.  It is a small temple which has the main hindu gods.  The night I went, there must have been a Ganesh festival because many people were there and service was going on.  Parking is tight (esp. if there is an event).  Inside is cozy and there is a separate small dining hall that can be accessed to the right as you walk out of the temple.
